NASA : Ames Research Center : The Astrophysics & Astrochemistry Laboratory

AmesPAHdbIDLSuite Manual

NASA Ames PAH IR Spectroscopic Database

The NASA Ames PAH IR Spectroscopic Database[1] (PAHdb hereafter) hosts the world’s foremost collection of infrared (IR) PAH spectra. PAHdb’s spectral libraries contain over 3,000 laboratory measured and quantum chemically computed PAH spectra. Beyond spectroscopic data, PAHdb also provides software tools to work with the spectral data. The portal to the data and tools is the PAHdb website, which is located at https://www.astrochemistry.org/pahdb. This is the manual for the AmesPAHdbIDLSuite and describes its features, capabilities and usage.

Last updated November 2023

Footnotes

[1] Since FY2019 the NASA Ames PAH IR Spectroscopic Database is being supported through a directed Work Package at NASA Ames titled: "Laboratory Astrophysics — The NASA Ames PAH IR Spectroscopic Database".
